content: I just saw the efg crate that replaces all() with &&, any() with ||, and not() with ! in #[cfg] attributes. Are there any compatibility concerns in permitting this in the compiler? I don't believe there are and think that this syntax would be a mark√®d improvement.
Could also change feature = "foo" into feature("foo"), giving it a function-like syntax.
I think this would be awesome, I have a hard time parsing cfg attributes when they are nested the new efg crate way seems much more readable!
Both of these ideas would be amazing
